results.title: Footnotes to a war
results.creator_credit: Simone Di Bagno and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: By focusing on three refugees from Southeast Asia - a former soldier turned medic, a child, and a young woman - this film highlights some of the problems of resettlement and ensuing loss of cultural identity. Narrated by Lu Yu. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Football: the sport of millions
results.brief_description: Football (soccer) is a peoples sport in the German Republic. Each weekend some 1.5 million spectators attend the games, and there are over 700,000 players in the 64,000 teams. 500,000 of these are juveniles playing in junior teams being trained in special training courses and schools.

results.title: Football
results.brief_description: Football (soccer) is a major sport and social phenomenon in Britain, where the game was born. Amateur players are the backbone of the sport, about half a million of them in England alone, mostly young and many belonging to England’s 30,000 amateur clubs. The film explains the history, the competition leading up to the Cup Final and how football is now a world sport including the Chinese, Nigerians and Argentinians who come and play well-known teams in Britain.

results.title: Foolish wives (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Erich Von Stroheim and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Von Stroheim wrote, directed and stars in this enormously expensive and lavish story of decadence and corruption in Monte Carlo after the Great War. Co-starring Maude George and Mae Busch.

results.title: Foods: fads and facts
results.brief_description: Discusses the effects of pesticides, preservatives and additives on foods and illustrates how government authorities maintain adequate safety levels on foods through constant supervision of food marketing. Also considers whether organic foods have any more nutritional value than foods grown with help of scientific knowledge. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Food: the story of a peanut butter sandwich
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, International Cinemedia Center and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: At a children’s party a contest is held to see who can make the most interesting sandwich. The popularity of peanut butter leads to an inquiry into food processing, its mechanics and economics. The filmmaker poses questions to the children about the origin of food, especially peanut butter, filling in the historical, geographic, cultural and other factors.
